title: suggestions for aggressive, adrenaline charged font
content: hi -- anything come to mind for a font that could work for Racing cars? i have been searching for days, nothing really popping out. the main letter is "S" so something with a curvy quality but bad a\*\*! thanks in advance for any suggestions! :)
author: adenson

comments.content:
Maiola comes to mind: [http://www.type-together.com/Maiola](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219/http:/www.type-together.com/Maiola "http://www.type-together.com/Maiola")

Agressive, stressed, somehow and somewhat unquiet, unpeaceful,... as if saying "Get out of my way!" Not bad for a racing car! Still not convinced? Then look at the italic capitals K, R , X,....!

Still not sold? Then wait for suggestions from the experts!

I'm personally not feeling it in Maiola, but it _does_ give me the idea of suggesting this:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/eskapade/fraktur-italic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/eskapade/fraktur-italic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/eskapade/fraktur-italic/")

Or what about this?  
 [http://www.themicrofoundry.com/other/nour&patria/dev/nour-latin.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219/http:/www.themicrofoundry.com/other/nour&patria/dev/nour-latin.gif "http://www.themicrofoundry.com/other/nour&patria/dev/nour-latin.gif")  
Although you'd want the Bold.

Or: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-alias/klute/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-alias/klute/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-alias/klute/")

But I'm sure better suggestions are on their way.

hhp
@adenson: Is this personal, professional, or academic work?

those are interesting ! thanks for making suggestions. :) i am thinking more masculine ... maybe yumi but outlined: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/yumi/bold-oblique/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/yumi/bold-oblique/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/yumi/bold-oblique/")
@chris -- it's for a friend but they may use it for business.
great font suggestion, chris. thank you!

I was actually half joking! Hilarious. Please post your work if you manage to pull off using [Slipstream](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsnerflake/slipstream/). I’d love to see it in action. If I’m not mistaken, it is mandatory that every city in the world have at least one courier service which uses this typeface ;)
:) i think we need something a little more cutting edge ... but yeah, i've seen that used a lot

The logos of some car companies known for speed don't necessarily reflect that in their font choices:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/car_logos_5136.jpg)

And most real race cars are covered with sponsor logos:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/car-logos_3548.jpg)

I know this info isn't particularly helpful to you, but just thought I'd point it out.

A few weeks ago I took my nephew to a monster truck show and many of those actually had more dramatic (but mostly juvenile) use of graphics and fonts.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123173219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/truck2_6553.jpg)

pablo, james, renko and té -- thanks so much. i am going to play with these font suggestions and see what he likes. james, good point about performance car companies. i really appreciate the input -- very helpful! some new fonts i hadn't seen ... :)
